text:
concept of all women following a rigid cervical dilatation rate of 1cm/hour during labour 
is 
not entirely correct, but that there is major variation in dilatation rate amongst women during normal labour. The WHO 
has introduced a new Labour Care Guide to replace the existing partogram. This tool will ensure qualit y, evidence-
based, woman-centred care for a positive childbirth experience within the context of a broader, rights-based approach.
